Key Match Events: The Phillies and Rays were locked in a tight game with the score tied going into the bottom of the eighth inning.
Cal Stevenson ripped a double down the right field line to score two runs.
Buddy Kennedy lined a single to right to score Stevenson.
Trea Turner clubbed his second homer of the game, making the score 9-4.
Bryce Harper roped an opposite field double.
Nick Castellanos was hit by a pitch from Edwin Uceta, leading to benches clearing and a scuffle.
Uceta was ejected from the game.
Post-Match Reflections: Phillies manager Rob Thomson described the emotions spilling over in the eighth inning as 'boys being boys'.
Nick Castellanos expressed that he believed Edwin Uceta intentionally hit him out of frustration.
Bryce Harper was very upset and stated that intentionally hitting players should not be accepted in Major League Baseball.
Kyle Schwarber also criticized Uceta's actions, calling them 'bullshit'.
The Phillies showed their togetherness and reduced their magic number to 10 to clinch the N.L. East.
